IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
Maryland State Police Easton Barrack "I"
MSP marked vehicle I-51, does have MVR and incident was recorded via body camera/In car camera.
 
• Defendant: Alonzo Soliz, Elder Adelvy
• Date of Birth: 11/30/2000
• Date of Arrest: 03/12/2023
• Times of Arrest: 0414 hours
• DUI #: 23-58-051 (Easton Barrack)

CERTIFICATION & TRAINING 
*Trained in administering standardized field sobriety tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA)
*Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (ARIDE)
*Preliminary Breath Test (PBT) Operator

VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1)

On 03/12/2023 at approximately 0353 hours, I, Trooper Repa #7124, Maryland State Police, Easton Barrack, was on stationary patrol in the area of Ocean Gateway and Sanderstown Road, Trappe, Talbot County, Maryland. I observed a white Toyota Tacoma traveling in lane 2 and I pointed my pro laser 3 at the vehicle. The pro laser 3 displayed the vehicle traveling 63 mph over the posted 55 mph zone. As the white Toyota came closer to my position, I observed the white Tacoma swerve from lane 2 with both left side tires going over the dotted white line into lane 1 approximately a foot. The vehicle tried to correct itself and I observed the white Tacoma’s left side tires went onto the white solid line along the shoulder. I pulled out behind the vehicle to follow. I observed the white Tacoma swerved again with its right tires going over the solid white line a foot hitting the rumble strips. The vehicle corrected itself and again went over the white solid line with its right tires a couple inches before correcting itself. I observed the vehicle to be a white Toyota Tacoma bearing Maryland registration 7EP2980. I activated my vehicles emergency lights/siren and conducted a traffic stop on the vehicle.

PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2)

I approached the white Toyota on the driver's side. I advised the driver the reason for the stop and requested his license and registration card. The driver was identified by his Maryland driver’s license as Elder Adelvy Alonzo Soliz (DOB 11/30/2000 H/M). I observed multiple open Modelo beer cans along with a box half full of approximately 24 Modelo beer cans. I asked Alonzo Soliz how much he had to drink, and he replied nothing. I advised Alonzo Soliz I detected an odor of alcoholic beverage on his breath and Alonzo Soliz looked shocked and didn’t respond. As I spoke with Alonzo Soliz, I observed his eyes to be glassy and bloodshot. I advised Alonzo Soliz I was going to perform standardized field sobriety tests to which he complied. I positioned Alonzo Soliz clear of traffic in front of my patrol vehicle.

PRE-ARREST SCREENING (PHASE 3)

The evaluation was performed in front of my marked patrol vehicle(I-51). The surface was dry, level, and free from any obvious debris. The weather was clear and the temperature was in the 40's. Lighting conditions consisted of my patrol vehicles headlights, patrol vehicle take down light, and my flashlight. All forward facing emergency vehicle lights were deactivated during the tests. Alonzo Soliz appeared to be in good physical condition and did not display any visible injuries.
Prior to starting the tests, Alonzo Soliz advised me he drank two Modelos that were laying in the rear seats of the Toyota prior to driving. Translate on my cellular phone was used to assist with field sobriety.
I asked Alonzo Soliz the following questions prior to performing field sobriety:
Currently any injuries? No
Currently taking any medications? No
Currently wears contacts or glasses? No

HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS (6/6 clues observed)

The first test given was the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test. I properly explained the test and used translate app to assist if Alonzo Soliz did not understand. A pen's tip was used as the stimulus for the test and held approximately 12 inches from Alonzo Soliz’s eyes. Alonzo Soliz was instructed to look straight ahead, keeping his head still while following and focusing on the tip of the stimulus with his eyes until told to stop. Alonzo Soliz’s pupils were equal in size and showed equal tracking. I asked Alonzo Soliz if he understood the directions, and he stated, “yes.” Alonzo Soliz was positioned away from passing traffic to ensure the results of the HGN test were not compromised.

1.) Lack of Smooth Pursuit - Present in both eyes
2.) Distinct and Sustained Nystagmus at Maximum Deviation – Present in both eyes
3.) Onset of Nystagmus Prior to 45 Degrees - Present in both eyes

*Vertical Gaze Nystagmus – Present in both eyes

WALK AND TURN (5/8 clues observed)
 
Prior to Alonzo Soliz performing the test, I properly explained the test and physically demonstrated how the test should be done. I asked Alonzo Soliz if he understood the instructions to the test to which he advised “yes”?

Instructional Stage:
1.) Stepped offline.

Walking Stage (1st Nine)
1.) Miss counted steps (13 steps).
2.) Stopped walking on step 12.
3.) Missed heel to toe on steps 4 through 12.

Walking Stage (2nd Nine)
1.) Miss count steps (10 steps).
2.) Missed heel to toe on every step.

Turn was done unsatisfactory. He failed to do turn as instructed. Alonzo Soliz fell off balance and moved both feet instead of pivoting.

ONE LEG STAND (2/4 clues observed)

Prior to Alonzo Soliz performing the test, I properly explained the test and physically demonstrated how the test should be done.  Alonzo Soliz was asked if he understood the test and the instructions to which he stated, “yes.”

Balance and Count Stage:
Seconds 1-10:
1.) Foot down.

Seconds 11-20:
1. Foot down.
2. Swayed.

Seconds 21-30:
1. Foot down.

Preliminary Breath Test:
I explained a Preliminary Breath Test (PBT). After explaining, Alonzo Soliz agreed with the result of .16.

ARREST :

Based on the following, I had reason to believe Alonzo Soliz was driving a motor vehicle impaired:
*strong smell of an alcoholic beverage on his breath.
*Open Modelo beer cans inside vehicle.
*unable to drive vehicle within lane.
*admission to consuming an alcoholic beverage.
*Glassy and bloodshot eyes.
*Observed signs of impairment as he performed field sobriety tests.
*PBT results.

I arrested Alonzo Soliz for driving under the influence at 0414 hours. He was placed in the front passenger seat of my patrol vehicle. Alonzo Soliz was read the DR-15 form on the Motor Vehicle Administration website in Spanish on my in-car laptop. At the conclusion of the form, Alonzo Soliz refused to submit to the intoximeter test and signed the DR-15 indicating the same (0445 hours). Alonzo Soliz was transported to the Easton State Police Barrack for processing.

Alonzo Soliz was given all copies of pertinent paperwork at the Easton State Police Barrack. Alonzo Soliz received a ride home from his friend’s wife.

All events occurred in Talbot County, Maryland.
I requested this case closed.
